info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 6:03PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Lewis and Clark and southwestern Teton Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 602 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 21 miles northwest of Augusta, or 29 miles west of Choteau, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pishkun Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
